Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
such a silly rule.
I was having this code:

`calcRoutes := app.Party("/maths")`
it compiles but never renders the path http://localhost:8080/maths and just gave 404 error.
I changed it to:
`mathsRoutes := app.Party("/maths")`
and it works!

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
The tl;dr; is 
Vuepress = markdown + vue SSG

like CC library, it would be nice to have vue-components (or react) that can work with KMD ecosystem to expedite front end PoC.

Here is info on vuepress https://vuepress.vuejs.org/guide/#life-cycle

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Anyone know the maximum size of a string that can be fed by an RPC call ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What I am working on here needs a certain size, but its pretty small in the scheme of things, so I want to make the RPC call take multiples of this size and then split it internally.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Like can you have in the json `"data": "abcdef02133"` and the hex string like 2MB or 10MB ? 20MB

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: no idea, i can't imagine there being a limit - only the buffer size of the server's implementation of serving - if you were to make a maximum buffer 64MB that would be it's limit.    maybe there is a timeout on the TCP connection which would be the limit for socket open.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: have you got a link to the socket open LoC (line of code)?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Also, if there are any ppl interested in making a java rpc client to go along with our javascript and python efforts, i had a little look last night and these would be the 1st two things i'd look at for basing a kmd one from - i dont' know if there are any more recent or more commonly used ones though, so still investigating https://gist.github.com/imylomylo/a5f6e26db56d1c5b028e00429545928d

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: at first I guess I will just limit to the TX chunk size to get it working... then play with it later on, dont want to overcomplicate it, struggling as it is. Definaly a good way to learn ğŸ˜…

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have a 60 line c program that can add to a queue and grab the first thing in the queue, and then remove it.... that seems to be the hardest aprt solved, as I have no idea what I as doing there.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yeah, what worked first was hardcoding data.   now move the hardcoding part further away.  it worked the first time.  use same technique "further upstream" so to speak.  send 8kB chunk to RPC, then 50kB chunk i guess.   if you can get it to work with 50kB chunk with RPC, i can look at sending real video from browser next week in <50kB chunks (10ms time chunks) at a time.  so you'll have packets arriving every 10ms this way, at least you'll get movement ğŸ¤·

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah .. not really concerned with having video exactly... I will probably start with just some random file and make sure it can be reassembled...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: once the RPC calls work, then someone can make a dAPP that works with video.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Keeping it super simple so it can be used for any data at all, is my plan here.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ok.  i'm going away for weekend so will not be on the tools.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: doubtful it will work beofre next week, this is slow going for me lol

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo there is no return limit, I have seen RPCs return 1GB of JSON
